DataElement.preferredName: Gastric Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for gastric carcinoma based on evidence obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the stomach._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the stomach.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/3/18 tmt transferred context from NCIP. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Gastric Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of gastric cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to all carcinomas that arise in the stomach. Gastrointestinal stromal tumors, sarcomas, lymphomas and well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (G1 and G2) are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gastric Cancer pN3b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gastric Cancer pN3b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in sixteen or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gastric Cancer pN3b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in sixteen or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gastric Cancer pN3a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gastric Cancer pN3a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in seven to fifteen regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gastric Cancer pN3a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in seven to fifteen regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gastric Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gastric Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gastric Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gastric Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gastric Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gastric Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gastric Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gastric Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gastric Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Gastric cancer with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gastric Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gastric Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastric cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gastric Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Gastric cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gastric Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gastric Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastric cancer in which the regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gastric Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Gastric cancer in which the regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
